intro: Armeria maghrebensis var. mamorensis, commonly known as the Mamorensis thrift, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
